creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: two young women walking down a street; woman on left wears a grey and white kimono and a purple and pink jacket and carries a grey parasol; woman on right wears a black kimono with pink leaves and a salmon-colored jacket; two women with one holding a baby, accompanied by a dog, in background at left; tree visible behind fence wall at right
inscription: left: 昭和十四年　晝の東京　白い倉 {Shōwa jūyonen saku, [?????, ?????]} | bottom, in grey: Kikuzaka Street | in pencil: Toshi Yoshida
markings: LRC, red artist\'s seal: 吉田{Yoshida}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Tokyo at Noon (晝の東京)
title: Kikuzaka Street
